speaker: Erin
text: The incident report was submitted this morning. Have you seen it yet?
ipa: ði ˈɪnsɪdənt rɪˈpɔrt wəz səbˈmɪtɪd ðɪs ˈmɔrnɪŋ. hæv ju sin ɪt jɛt?

speaker: Luis
text: Yeah, I have. Apparently, the wrong config file was deployed to production.
ipa: jæ, aɪ hæv. əˈpɛrəntli ðə rɔŋ ˈkɒnfɪɡ faɪl wəz dɪˈplɔɪd tu prəˈdʌkʃən.

speaker: Erin
text: Do we know how it was missed during the staging review?
ipa: du wi noʊ haʊ ɪt wəz mɪst ˈdʊrɪŋ ðə ˈsteɪʤɪŋ rɪˈvju?

speaker: Luis
text: Not exactly. The staging review was performed, but the validation script was skipped by accident.
ipa: nɑt ɪɡˈzæktli. ðə ˈsteɪʤɪŋ rɪˈvju wəz pərˈfɔrmd, bət ðə ˌvælɪˈdeɪʃən skrɪpt wəz skɪpt baɪ ˈæksɪdənt.

speaker: Erin
text: That’s a serious oversight. Has the person responsible been identified?
ipa: ðæts ə ˈsɪriəs ˈoʊvərˌsaɪt. hæz ðə ˈpɜrsən rɪˈspɒnsəbl bɪn aɪˈdɛntəˌfaɪd?

speaker: Luis
text: It hasn’t been confirmed yet, but the DevOps team is being interviewed today.
ipa: ɪt ˈhæzənt bɪn kənˈfɜrmd jɛt, bət ðə ˈdɛvˌɒps tim ɪz ˈbiɪŋ ˈɪntərˌvjud təˈdeɪ.

speaker: Erin
text: Good. And the faulty deployment — has it been rolled back?
ipa: ɡʊd. ənd ðə ˈfɔlti dɪˈplɔɪmənt — hæz ɪt bɪn roʊld bæk?

speaker: Luis
text: Yes, it was reverted as soon as the error was discovered. No user data was affected, fortunately.
ipa: jɛs, ɪt wəz rɪˈvɜrtɪd əz sun əz ði ˈɛrər wəz dɪˈskʌvərd. noʊ ˈjuzər ˈdeɪtə wəz əˈfɛktɪd, ˈfɔrʧənətli.

speaker: Erin
text: Still, a root cause analysis needs to be written, and preventive steps must be proposed.
ipa: stɪl, ə rut kɔz əˈnæləsɪs nidz tu bi ˈrɪtən, ənd prɪˈvɛntɪv stɛps məst bi prəˈpoʊzd.

speaker: Luis
text: Agreed. An internal audit has already been scheduled for Thursday.
ipa: əˈɡrid. ən ɪnˈtɜrnəl ˈɔdɪt hæz ɔlˈrɛdi bɪn ˈskɛʤəld fɔr ˈθɜrzdeɪ.

speaker: Erin
text: Let me know once the RCA is drafted. We’ll need it ready before the leadership sync.
ipa: lɛt mi noʊ wʌns ði ˌɑr.siˈeɪ ɪz ˈdræftɪd. wil nid ɪt ˈrɛdi bɪˈfɔr ðə ˈlidərˌʃɪp sɪŋk.
